Text.Value: It's your home. It's worth protecting.
Every death was in service of my god.
Still, there would be little more than ashes left of the grove without you.
Too right. Home is where you belong, not where you're born. This - this is where I belong.
If you're looking for coin, you're out of luck. I'm a healer, not a moneylender.
I'm still waiting for an apology for trying to kill me.
You're just lucky I didn't swig that poison.
This place... this place means everything to me.
Thank you.
I am sorry for that, but the whole grove was at risk.
I... hoped you'd had other motives, but I'll take what I can get.
I was sure we wouldn't live to see the morrow.
Thank you for everything you've done.
Of course, it's my duty to help those in need.
You kept your word. Thank you.
Silvanus be with you, my friend.

EditorData.NodeContext: in awe of what we've done for her and slightly tearful

Text.Value: Well, you certainly took out more than your fair share.
I'm still not comfortable with your tadpole, but I owe you a chance. Thank you.
This is a sacred place - it had to be protected.
Hah! Look, I'm sorry. I didn't know what to do when you told me about that tadpole.
Thank you for saving it. For saving Master Halsin. For everything.
I was certain your parasite had taken hold.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Nettie returns to the grove. She is talking to the player who revealed the truth about their tadpole

Text.Value: Thank you for saving Master Halsin. For saving my home. For everything.
I'm glad I was wrong.
You're very welcome.
Thanks are fine. A reward is better.
The goblins may be gone, but it cost Master Halsin his life...
It was a glorious fight! One to be relished.
Whatever about the grove, I won't be at peace until Master Halsin returns.
Whatever your motives, my home is still standing - because of you. I'll always be grateful for that.
But I'll have the chance - thanks to you.
Blessed day, I was worried I'd never see Master Halsin again.
I don't know if I can ever restore Silvanus' peace to this place.
Thank you for saving my home.

EditorData.logicalname: no halsin or he is dead

Text.Value: I'm sorry neither of us could save you from that tadpole. I hope it ends well for you.
I'm glad you were on our side.
And bloody hells, did we need it.
But here - to mend any hurts.
I'll stay here until Master Halsin returns. I still believe he's out there somewhere.
It was a pleasure to crush some goblin skulls.
Glad I was wrong.
I fought for the refugees, not for you.
Damn right. If not for me, you'd all be dead.
I don't know how we'll go on, but we must. For him.
May Master Halsin rest in the Deep Forest.

Synopsis:
|Dialog used:
- after Attack on Den (tieflings won)
- after Goblin Hunt|
